item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Alien Frontiers
item.comment: AF is a flawed gem. My favorite theme plus my favorite mechanic ("euro dice") mixed with some amateurish design decisions. As a result I enjoy and tolerate it at the same time.

item.name: Bora Bora
item.comment:
Bora Bora is directly competing with Castles of Burgundy for my favorite game of all time. It's an amazing game, but there are few things going against it as well.
Some of the good things (this list is much longer in my head): - Dice mechanism is a new twist on worker placement. It's original and familiar at the same time. It is essentially the same as in any classic WP, such as Agricola - but your workers are "weighted" here. In Agricola, workers a strictly blocking (as if they were all dice value "1"). In Bora Bora, the higher the dice value, the stronger the worker power, but it's ability to block and to not be blocked decreases. Simple and genius. - I love how tasks are implemented here. You sort of feel that you are filling 3 glasses at once, trying to make sure you have at least one glass full by the end of a round, at which point you replace it with a new glass, and by the end of the game you need to fill 9 glasses. It's a very pleasant balancing act. - Island minigame actually reminds me of Burgundy, yet it is different enough. While the map itself is static, the fishes are laid out randomly each game, making the island setup different and presenting a new puzzle every time.
Not so good: - I love tropical theme. In Bora Bora however, it doesn't work. Not necessarily because of the weak thematic connection of mechanics, which is expected of Feld, but because tropical theme sets expectation of something more relaxing and lighthearted, while here we get nothing but a heavy euro which requires you to concentrate and work. - The game feels slightly "overwritten". I'm afraid to teach it anybody but the most seasoned gamers. That severely limits my options to actually get this game out..

item.name: Bruges
item.comment: Far from my favorite Feld (a bit too much randomness for my taste), yet still very enjoyable.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: Dice mechanic is similar to Feld's own Roma. However similarities between these 2 games end right there. BvB is an excellent medium weight euro. In fact, it is gradually becoming my favorite game. Ever.

item.name: Chinatown
item.comment: The ideas of PvP trading has always attracted me. But the actual games that I've tried over the years kept failing in this department. I started to think that perhaps trading just doesn't work the way I want to in games.. And then I tried Chinatown. This game is pure magic. I explain the rules in 2 minutes, and as soon as the game starts, all the trading "hell" breaks loose. What a fantastic game!

item.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game
Dixit
item.comment: Best party game ever. I own all 3.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
A Fake Artist Goes to New York
Firenze
item.comment: Surprise of the year (2013) for me. Sweet, sweet game!

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
In the Year of the Dragon
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
Istanbul
item.comment: I may be one of the first people on earth to purchase Istanbul :) I was on a trip to Germany and happened to be at a game store when the clerk was literally just putting the game out on the table. Unfortunately I won't be able to play it for another 2 weeks - still traveling. I did read the rules and it looks very intriguing.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
The Name of the Rose
item.comment: I've read some polarized opinions about this early Feld's game. For me, it turned out to be somewhere right in the middle. A little bit, but not terribly strategic, and a little bit, but not terribly fun.

item.name: Perry Rhodan: The Cosmic League
item.comment: That's a lot of game packed into a small box and a small play time! One of my and my wife's favorites.

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Builders Duel
Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Railways of the World: The Card Game
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Saint Petersburg: New Society & Banquet Expansion
Santiago de Cuba
item.comment: Played on yucata and liked it enough to purchase a physical copy. I used to own Havana, but it didn't quite fulfill it's promise so I traded it away. I never played Cuba. I don't have a ton of resource management games. So, Santiago de Cuba, although just another euro, fits fine in my collection. Especially since it plays best with 2. Oh, and it looks gorgeous!

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Takenoko
item.comment: So glad I bought it. 2nd half of 2011 was the time of failures for me. This is the 1st game in a long while that didn't disappoint. It looks absolutely gorgeous (it helps that I love oriental theme), it has my favorite mechanics - action points and secret goals. Everything works extremely well. Due to wonderful theme integration, the game is super easy to teach. Note however - this is pretty much family and non-gamer affair. I think this is the 1st real contender for the 2012 SDJ.

item.name: Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise
The Three Musketeers: The Queen's Pendants
Trajan
item.comment:
I'm a huge fan of Stefan Feld, have about all of his games, with Burgundy and Macao being the favorites. I had of course the highest expectations for Trajan while patiently waiting for it for almost half a year. It is finally here and so far i only played one game. Here are some early impressions.. Well, to sum it up, I'm slightly underwhelmed. Here is why:
- It is indeed his most complex game, a bit too complex for my taste. Also a bit too long. I do feel however that it will get easier/faster after repeated plays.. if I can get it to the table! - The mancala felt a bit too uncontrollable and frustrating during this 1st game. I hope it will get better! - Replayability may not be as good as some of Stefan's other games, because the same materials are used in every game and setup is pretty much fixed. - The game is too mechanical and disconnected from theme, even for Feld. It probably doesn't help that I don't care for the Roman theme, to put it mildly. In fact I'm sick and tired of all the forums, senates and laurels, to put it less mildly.
Even despite of these flaws, you can see I can't help but rate Trajan a 9. I still enjoyed it more than %90 of mediocre stuff I played this year. I think it will only get better.

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment: Till the very last moment (while learning the game at my table) I was afraid that this is going to be meh. But then, after playing the game, I can assure all euro lovers that Tzolkin is really, really great!

item.name: Undermining
item.comment: I love pickup and deliver games, upgrades and action points, so I thought nothing could go wrong with this one. But somehow it fell flat. I like good family games but this one is perhaps a bit too simple. I'll stick to my other favorites in this genre - Finca, Bombay & Perry Rhodan.

item.name: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game
